author: Special Correspondent
text:
Harvested organs from accident victim Vasanthakumar (inset) being taken from theKalyani Kidney Care Centre in Erode on Monday to hospitals in Coimbatore.— PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

The family of a brain-dead accident victim of Sithikullanur village in Mettur taluk came forward to donate vital organs on Monday.

The victim, Vasanthakumar (55), was knocked down on Friday night by a lorry in front of Mecheri Bus Stand. He was rushed to Omalur Government Hospital and from there to a private hospital where he was declared brought brain-dead.

The family members then brought the victim to the Kalyani Kidney Care Centre, the nearest hospital certified to harvest organs.

Tests were carried out and the liver and kidneys were found to be in good condition, said M. Prabakar, consultant urologist and managing director of the Hospital.

Retrieval of organs was carried out for the first time at the hospital in an hour-long operation, and a green corridor was created by the police department to transport a kidney to KG Hospital and the liver to Kovai Medical Centre Hospital. The organs were transported in 45 minutes.

The other kidney was assigned for transplant at the Kalyani Kidney Care Centre itself by the Tamil Nadu Network for Organ Sharing, Dr. Prabakar said.

All the three transplants were carried out successfully, Dr. Prabakar said.
title: Organs harvested from brain-dead victim transplanted
